sourceMeaningMnemonic: For your <radical>car</radical> you use a <radical>hat</radical>, some <radical>ground</radical> and a <radical>bookshelf</radical> to build a new <kanji>wheel</kanji>. I mean, it's generally <kanji>ring</kanji> and <kanji>loop</kanji> shaped, it just needs to be a <kanji>circle</kanji>, so it should work, right?
meaningInfo: Imagine this wheel you made out of a hat, some ground (presumably to keep it all together), and a bookshelf. You install it on your car and hope for the best. This is why you should buy wheels from professional wheel makers.
readingMnemonic: Your <kanji>wheel</kanji> is... generally <reading>rin</reading>g (<ja>りん</ja>) shaped, so that's good.
readingInfo: A ring-shaped wheel is better than nothing. Hopefully it will get you where you need to go.
